title: Copyright
publication_title: Pissarro Paintings and Works on Paper at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section body" id="body">© 2015 The Art Institute of Chicago

All rights reserved. No part of this publication may be reproduced, transmitted, or utilized in any form or by any means, electronic or mechanical, including photocopy, digital recording, or any other information storage or retrieval system (beyond that copying permitted by Sections 107 and 108 of the U.S. Copyright Law), without prior written permission from the Department of Publishing of the Art Institute of Chicago, except by a reviewer, who may quote brief passages.  

First edition  
ISBN: 978-0-86559-276-6

Produced by the Department of Publishing  
at the Art Institute of Chicago  
Sarah E. Guernsey, Executive Director  
Edited by Amy R. Peltz  
Proofread by Jane Friedman  
Production by Amy Parkolap with assistance by Lara Ditkoff and Berke Yazicioglu  
Photography research by Katie Levi  
Designed by Beata Hosea  
OSCI-Toolkit and ChicagoCodeX Development by Tina Shah

Unless otherwise noted all overall high-resolution color photographs and UV photographs of the works in the catalogue were made by the Department of Imaging at the Art Institute of Chicago, Christopher Gallagher, Director of Photography, Louis Meluso, Director of Imaging Technology, and are copyrighted by the Art Institute of Chicago.  

Unless otherwise noted, photography of works of art is by Chris Gallagher, Bob Hashimoto, and Robert Lifson, with postproduction by Jonathan Mathias, and coordinated by PD Young and Amy Zavaleta, Department of Imaging, the Art Institute of Chicago.

The majority of technical and scientific images of the works in the catalogue were produced by conservators and scientists within the Department of Conservation and the Department of Prints and Drawings at the Art Institute of Chicago, and copyrighted by the Art Institute of Chicago.

Unless otherwise noted, technical images of paintings were captured and registered by Kelly Keegan; technical images of works of art on paper were captured by Kimberly Nichols; and cross-section images were captured by Frederica Pozzi and Inge Fiedler.

X-rays were digitally composited by Robert G. Erdmann, Rijksmuseum, University of Amsterdam, and Radboud University, Nijmegen, Neth.

Thread-count- and thread-angle maps were generated by Don Johnson, Rice University, using Thread Count Automation Project software.

Hyperspectral and false-color- and modified-infrared images were captured and processed by John K. Delaney and Kathryn A. Dooley (National Gallery, Washington, D.C.) and registered by Damon M. Conover (the Washington University) and Kelly Keegan.  

Unless otherwise stated, all photographs appear by permission of the lenders mentioned in the captions. Every effort has been made to contact and acknowledge copyright holders for all reproductions; additional rights holders are encouraged to contact the Art Institute of Chicago. The following credits apply to all images in this catalogue for which separate acknowledgement is due.

</section>
